message.content:
cs.SC, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.NA, cs.LO. 

This paper deals with the analysis of linear difference equations, which is a topic that falls under the scope of several arXiv CS sub-categories. The most likely category is cs.SC (Symbolic Computation), as the paper involves the study of rational function coefficients and the detection and removal of singularities, which are topics that are closely related to symbolic manipulation and computation. The second likely category is cs.SY (Systems and Control), as the paper deals with first order systems of difference equations and their behavior, which is a topic that is relevant to control theory and dynamical systems. The third likely category is cs.DS (Discrete Mathematics), as the paper deals with difference equations, which are a type of discrete dynamical system. The fourth likely category is cs.NA (Numerical Analysis), as the paper presents algorithms for desingularization of difference systems, which is a topic that is relevant to numerical methods for solving differential and difference equations. The fifth likely category is cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science), as the paper involves the study of the connection between poles of solutions and removable singularities, which is a topic that is relevant to mathematical logic and reasoning.
